cerazette.name: Cerazette vs. Desogestrel
title: Prescribing of branded Cerazette (BNF code 0703021Q0BB)
compared with prescribing of all desogestrel (BNF code 0703021Q0)
description: as a proportion of total quantity of desogestrel
why_it_matters: This is the NHS Business Service Authority's top cost-saver from
generic switching. Cerazette and desogestrel are both exactly
the same drug, the same molecule, but Cerazette is an expensive
branded package, and desogestrel is a cheap generic package.

pioglitazone.name: Pioglitazone Hydrochloride vs. all Antidiabetic Drugs
title: Prescribing of Pioglitazone Hydrochloride (BNF code 0601023B0)
compared with prescribing of all Antidiabetic Drugs (BNF code 6.1.2).
description: Number of prescription items for Pioglitazone Hydrochloride (0601023B0)
as a percentage of total prescription items for all diabetes (060102).
why_it_matters: Rosiglitazone is an antidiabetic drug that turned out to increase the risk of heart problems, and was effectively withdrawn from the market. There is concern that the problems may have been a 'class effect', covering other related drugs, and so doctors have tended to also stop using pioglitazone. This shows how local practice reflects that national trend. However, the latest NICE guidance on diabetes recommends it equally with other drugs, so it may become more popular again.

celecoxib.name: Celecoxib vs. all NSAIDs
title: Prescribing of Celecoxib (BNF code 0801050AY, 1001010AH)
compared with prescribing of all Non-Steroidal
Anti-Inflammatory Drugs (BNF section 1.1.1)
description: Number of prescription items for Celecoxib (0801050AY, 1001010AH)
as a percentage of total prescription items for all NSAIDs (100101).
why_it_matters: Coxib drugs are an interesting illustration of a common
phenomenon in medicine: the need to make a trade off
between risk and benefit, in different patients.
Long term use of NSAID painkillers puts patients at
increased risk of gastric bleeds. Coxib painkillers
are effective at treating pain, with lower risk of
bleeding; but they are much more expensive, and come
with a higher risk of cardiovascular problems. Overall,
therefore, they are sensible to use in some patients,
but if one area is prescribing a lot of coxibs (or
very few) then that may mean that they have unusual
patients, or it may mean that doctors' thresholds
for using them are different to their colleagues nationally.

keppra.name: Keppra vs. levetiracetam
title: Prescribing of branded Keppra (BNF code 0408010A0BB)
compared with prescribing of all levetiracetam (BNF code 0408010A0)
description: as a proportion of total quantity of levetiracetam
why_it_matters: This is one of the NHS Business Service Authority's top cost-savers from
generic switching. Keppra is an expensive branded form of the chemical
levetiracetam. The MHRA's guidance is that it is usually unnecessary
to maintain patients on a specific manufacturer's levetiracetam product
unless there are specific concerns such as patient anxiety, or risk of
confusion or dosing errors.
